about.name: Wissal Gharbi
about.title: Software Engineer
about.background: Software Engineer with experience in full stack development.
about.description: I specialize in creating scalable applications using Angular and Java.

entries.title: Front End Developer
responsibilities: Took charge of front-end development efforts, focusing on crafting intuitive user interfaces and enhancing user experience for both desktop (JavaFX) and web (Angular) applications.
Implemented and rigorously tested new features using Angular for web solutions, aligning closely with stakeholder needs and user feedback to deliver innovative solutions.
Implementation and development solutions for the migration of desktop applications to web-based platforms, utilizing Java and Spring Boot for back-end support.

entries.title: Full Stack Developer
responsibilities: Development of new functionalities for an online dry cleaning website with ASP .Net and Angular.
Development and implementation of evolution for the point of sales and the management and statistics system of the application with Laravel and VueJs.
Take into account requests for fixes and follow-up of the delivery of changes.
Carrying out unit tests and working with NGRX for an SSII platform with Angular.

entries.title: Full Stack Developer
responsibilities: Development of new modules for the application which allows the management of the activity of General Assistance.

entries.title: Data Scientist Intern
responsibilities: Implementing a fraud detection system for automobile insurance.
Generate a predictive model for fraud detection.
Developing a web application to display the result of the prediction.

entries.title: Software Developer Intern
responsibilities: Developing an internal complaint ticket management web application.

entries.title: Software Developer Intern
responsibilities: Developing a stock management web application.

entries.title: Graduation Project Intern
responsibilities: Audit of 3G / 4G, VOICE / DATA access network and development of an automation tool for reporting to the 3G / 4G access network.
